hanzi-su-wiki:
賃

Значения

Зарплата, плата

Мнемоника

Нанимать, т.е. поручать 任 работу за деньги 貝.

Варианты

赁

heisig_constituent: fare, responsibility, person, porter, drop, samurai, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
Keyword_KANJIDIC: fare, fee, hire, rent, wages, charge
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: плата за проезд, плата, аренда, аренда, заработная плата, плата
koohiiStory1: It´s your own responsibility to pay the bus fare with the correct number of shells/money.
koohiiStory2: In Japan they have automatic ticket gates so you cant easily cheat on your train fare. In England however the ticket gates are fairly open. It is a different kind of system. In England you are given the RESPONSIBILITY to put in the right amount of MONEY, but if you are caught cheating, the fines are stiff and you feel like a real CHINCHIN. "un.CHIN".
jp_example_words:
運賃(うんちん): freight rates, shipping expenses, fare
賃金(ちんぎん): wages
家賃(やちん): rent
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The leader who is king of every shellfish sets the rent for everyone. If you rent a home in King Shellfish's kingdom, the rent will be set by the great shellfish leader himself.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: King Shellfish loves when people rent from him. Imagine him rolling in all of the rent money (shellfish) he collected from all the people who rent from him. Hear his shell clattering as he frolics on all the dead shells from the shellfish.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you don't have enough shellfish to pay your rent, King Shellfish will punch you in the chin (ちん).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel your entire body shaking, but especially your chin, as you tell him you're two shellfish short on rent this month. The last thing you see is his big fist coming right for your chin.
Ru_Meaning: fare, fee, hire, rent, wages, charge
Ru_Radicals: 化 (превращаться), ハ, 王 (монарх), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) is responsible (任) for the wages
humanum_short_description_en:
The inscriptions from " Bei ", " Ren " sound. It is read through " Ren ", which means responsibility. Zhongshan Wangding: "It is suitable for the subject (righteousness) to know the lease of the society (ji)," and also express the appointment. Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "Yu Zhi (zhi) ) It is loyal and trustworthy, and leases (ren) the state."

"Said Wen": "Yong Ye. From Bei Ren Sheng." Duan Yucai's note: "Meaners are today's servants.... Servants, renters. Everyone who hires a man is called a mediocre, a rent.
humanum_short_description:
金文從「貝」，「任」聲。通讀為「任」，表示責任，中山王鼎：「使知社禝(稷)之賃(任)，臣主之宜(義)。」又表示委任，中山王方壺：「余智(知)其忠信也，而專賃(任)之邦。」

　　《說文》：「庸也。从貝任聲。」段玉裁注：「庸者今之傭字。……傭，賃也。凡僱僦皆曰庸，曰賃。」

賃字的基本解释

賃
lìn
见“赁”。

賃字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lìn］
［《廣韻》乃禁切，去沁，娘。］
［《集韻》如鴆切，去沁，日。］
“赁1”的繁体字。
(1)出卖劳力；受雇。
(2)指雇佣。
(3)工钱，给受雇人的报酬。
(4)租赁；租用。
(5)出租。
(6)通“任”。

賃字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　賃； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1207第22
【廣韻】乃禁切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】女禁切，?音任。【說文】庸也。【玉篇】借傭也。【類篇】以財雇物也。【史記·范雎傳】臣爲人庸賃。　又【廣雅】僭也。　【集韻】或作任。

賃字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
賃字的起名意思

暂无。

Name meaning

lìn
вм. 赁
Radicals: ｲ, 王, 貝  (leader, king, shellfish)
Meaning Mnemonic
The leader who is king of every shellfish sets the rent for everyone. If you rent a home in King Shellfish's kingdom, the rent will be set by the great shellfish leader himself.
King Shellfish loves when people rent from him. Imagine him rolling in all of the rent money (shellfish) he collected from all the people who rent from him. Hear his shell clattering as he frolics on all the dead shells from the shellfish.
Reading Mnemonic
If you don't have enough shellfish to pay your rent, King Shellfish will punch you in the chin (ちん).
Feel your entire body shaking, but especially your chin, as you tell him you're two shellfish short on rent this month. The last thing you see is his big fist coming right for your chin.
